original: Karlberg, Robert, civilingenjör, Vim-mierby, f. 26/11/92 i Vimmerby av garverifabr. C. E. K. o. Ida Sundin. G. 3i2 m. Margareta Hanisison. Barn: Inger f. 35, Stig 37, Marie-Louise 43, Ulrika 45. — Stiud:ex. i Lund IL, fil kand. 15, tillf. stud. v. KTH 15-16, ord. Lstud. där 16-17 (Kemi). Res. t. Tyskil. 20, 26, 32, Frankr. 20, 26, Engl., USA (f. stud. inom pappers- o. cellulosaind.) o. Canada 23 o. 31, Ryssl. 30, Ital. 32, Norge, Danm. o. Finl. uppr. ggr. Anst. v. Sthlms Superfosfatfabr. A-B, Ljungaverk, 17, Holmens Bruks o. Fabr.* A-B i Norrköp. 17-28, chefskemist v. samma bol. pappersbruk i Hallstavik 28-46, ing. f. sulfitfabr. där 42-46, verkst. dir. o. styr:led. i Kem. kontr :byrån i Sthlm 40-45. Styr:led. o. deläg. fr. 18 o. ing. fr. 46 i Vimmerby Läderfabr. A-B. Sekr. i Sv. pappersbr :fören. komm. f. ind. avloppsvatten 40-46, be-siktn :man f. motorford. h. Sv. auto-mobilfören. 25-28, led. av komm:fullm., kyrkofullm., folksk :styr. m. m. i Hä-verö 42-46, styr :led. i hemv :kretsnd 42-46 o. i Hallstaviks luftsk :fören. 40-46, v. ordf., sen. ordf. i Hallstaviks skyttefören. 40-46, ordf. i norra Roslags skyttekrets 42-46, ordf. i Sv. mo-torkl. östg:avd., styr :led. i centr:styr. 24-29. Skr.: Luftfuktigh. inv. v. fuk-tigh :bestämn. å papper (25), Om pH-kontr. v. pappersbruk (29), Slemav- sättn. i cellulosa- o. pappersfabr. o. deras bekämp. m. klor o. kloramin m. m. (34), Om frisyratorn o. likn. anordn. v. sulfitsyraberedn. (42). Hobby: skytte. Medl. av Frimurarorden. Riksluftsk-förb. ftjt.
translated:
Karlberg, Robert, civil engineer, born on 26/11/92 in Vimmerby to tannery factory owner C.E.K. and Ida Sundin. Married on 3/12/ xx to Margareta Hanisison. Children: Inger (born) 1935, Stig 1937, Marie-Louise 1943, Ulrika 1945. 

Education: High school diploma in Lund IL, bachelor's degree in 1915, temporary student at KTH 1915-1916, regular student there 1916-1917 (Chemistry). Traveled to Germany in 1920, 1926, 1932, France in 1920, 1926, England, USA (for study in the paper and cellulose industry) and Canada in 1923 and 1931, Russia in 1930, Italy in 1932, Norway, Denmark, and Finland several times. 

Employment: Worked at Stockholm Superphosphate Factory A-B in Ljungaverk from 1917, Holmen Works and Factory A-B in Norrköping from 1917-1928, chief chemist at the same company's paper mill in Hallstavik from 1928-1946, engineer at the sulfite factory there from 1942-1946, managing director and board member of the Chemical Contractor Bureau in Stockholm from 1940-1945. Board member and co-owner since 1918 and engineer since 1946 at Vimmerby Leather Factory A-B. Secretary of the Swedish Paper Industry Association's committee for industrial wastewater from 1940-1946, inspector for motor vehicles for the Swedish Automobile Association from 1925-1928, member of municipal councils, church councils, and primary school boards in Häverö from 1942-1946, board member of the local home guard district from 1942-1946 and Hallstavik Air Rifle Association from 1940-1946, vice chairman and later chairman of Hallstavik Shooting Association from 1940-1946, chairman of the northern Roslagen shooting district from 1942-1946, chairman of the Swedish Motor Club's eastern division, board member of the central board from 1924-1929. 

Publications: "Humidity Testing in Paper Production" (1925), "pH Control in Paper Mills" (1929), "Deposition of Slime in Cellulose and Paper Mills and their Combat with Chlorine and Chloramine, etc." (1934), "On the Curling Iron and Similar Devices in Sulfite Acid Production" (1942). Hobby: Shooting. Member of the Freemasonry Order. National Air Force Association, etc.
